abstract.text: A mechanism for grouping multiple layer-tree operations into atomic updates to the render tree.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: is the Core Animation mechanism for batching multiple layer-tree operations into atomic updates to the render tree. Every modification to a layer tree must be part of a transaction. Nested transactions are supported.
Core Animation supports two types of transactions:

transactions. Implicit transactions are created automatically when the layer tree is modified by a thread without an active transaction and are committed automatically when the threadâ€™s runloop next iterates. Explicit transactions occur when the the application sends the
message before modifying the layer tree, and a

allows you to override default animation properties that are set for animatable properties. You can customize duration, timing function, whether changes to properties trigger animations, and provide a handler that informs you when all animations from the transaction group are completed.
During a transaction you can temporarily acquire a recursive spin lock for managing property atomicity.
supports nested transactions. The following code shows how you can fade out a layer (named

) over a 2 second duration while scaling it to three times its original size. The scale animation is within a nested transaction with its own duration of 1 second. After the outer transaction completes, a completion block removes

code: // Outer transaction animates `opacity` to 0 over 2 seconds
// Inner transaction animates scale to (3, 3, 3) over 1 second

abstract.text: Render, compose, and animate visual elements.
An object that allows multiple animations to be grouped and run concurrently.
A mechanism for grouping multiple layer-tree operations into atomic updates to the render tree.
Returns the animation duration used by all animations within this transaction group.
Returns the timing function used for all animations within this transaction group.
Begin a new transaction for the current thread.
Commit all changes made during the current transaction.
Returns the completion block object.
Returns whether actions triggered as a result of property changes made within this transaction group are suppressed.
Flushes any extant implicit transaction.
Attempts to acquire a recursive spin-lock lock, ensuring that returned layer values are valid until unlocked.
Sets the animation duration used by all animations within this transaction group.
Sets the timing function used for all animations within this transaction group.
Sets the completion block object.
Sets whether actions triggered as a result of property changes made within this transaction group are suppressed.
Sets the arbitrary keyed-data for the specified key.
Relinquishes a previously acquired transaction lock.
Returns the arbitrary keyed-data specified by the given key.

The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
